content.label: Sooooooo good

Bossa Studios, you have brought me one amazing game! It's just the right amount of difficulty, easy to use controls. The one and only thing that bugs me is a kinda big deal to me. The story. It is amazing and has a deep message, but I feel it ended WAY to abruptly. I mean, after Benjamin goes blind, it ends. What the heck? If you give me another expansion with what happens to Sarah and Anna, I will rate 5 stars.

"Thomas Was Alone" lives up to its reviews. It's more than a game it's an experience. I can't wait to travel with Thomas through the levels and he grows stronger and battles his loneliness. Thank you for an incredible story.

The challenges are tedious and mostly brainless. The graphics, though clean, are minimal. The story and narration are rich and sparkly, though the one trick pony of richly characterizing geometric shapes loses it's novelty. All in all, this would be worth a buck or two. But charging more than double the price of The Room, World of Goo or Limbo is absurd. I don't get these positive reviews, and having paid $9 for this utterly mediocre title, I feel scammed.
Bored with life? Tired of acting like you're interested? Want to kill some time? This is that miracle.
What really makes this game is the characters and storytelling, which should surprise no one. I loved the pacing of the story, and the characters are so big despite being little blocks!
Refined minimalist game with excellent soundtrack. Played through it all a year ago, just started a second time through.
As a puzzle game, it is good. As a story, it is pure genius. You will feel complex emotions for these quirky, loveable, and flawed little rectangles!
Love the art, and ambient music.
So far worth the money

Thomas Was Alone appropriately eschews the current trend of ultra hard platformers. Instead, the game tells a story. Some levels were difficult, but not in the Super Meat Boy vein of difficulty. Some levels are simply chill, moving around rectangles and listending to their story. I hope more games follow this example.
I 1st played on consoles and finally noticed it was available for iPhones. As fun and relaxing to play as ever!

It's cute at first, but once I realized the narration doesn't relate to gameplay, I've been playing with the sound off and not reading the text boxes.

I was enjoying the puzzles, despite the poor controls, up until level 5.0 or so, when the game became more arcade style with time constraints. At that point the bad controls  went from being a nuisance to a major flaw and I gave up.
Charming and fun; a real gem.
Excellent narration, brilliant puzzles and extraordinary music.
Amazing game, engaging story, fun gameplay, must have app.

…accompanied by some really fun platforming. The characters really fit their shapes and abilities. Loads of fun, really well crafted. Works great on iPhone as well as the other platforms it can be found on.
Simple yet full of effort and creativity. Genius. Pure genius. I cannot describe how impressed I am with this app game.
I enjoyed this game, especially the interestingly different style of platforming!
Fun game, great narration and puzzle solving.
Also, the music is great.
But fun

It's amazing what can come from just a few blocks, and a simple design. Thomas Was Alone is a beautiful puzzle/adventure game, that can surprise you from the first second. This game isn't actually made just for kids. Anyone can enjoy it, and I certainly did. The only problem is that it can get slightly tedious and boring, and the puzzles aren't very difficult, but other than that, this game is amazing. 7.5/10

A truly fantastic app. I love the narration, it's almost better than the game itself. And the simplicity of the game is phenomenal. Honestly, it's the best game I've possibly ever played. It's addictive, though not in an annoying way. It's very intellectual- The geometry and physics of it are really puzzling, it truly makes you think.

My only complaint, would be the lack of more levels. I suppose it's one of those one-hit-wonder sort of things, but it felt like it needed more... Like it shouldn't have ended there, like there was more to the story. Maybe it's hard to get the narrator back, and I understand the process of these type of games must be truly difficult, but I loved Thomas, James, Chris, Laura, and all the rest... I hate to see them end here. It feels like a cliff. A gap in their journey, that is in need of fulfillment. Those were my thoughts, anyway. I'm just a lowly 11-year-old though, so I suppose that I may not understand the complexity of the game-making world. The best game I've played yet though- So keep up the good work and hopefully keep up the creative Thomas characters, and make them alive again!!! They deserve the five-star-rating!!!$
An enjoyable casual game, with lovely voice acting and a very creative theme. Well worth playing!

title.label: A side scroll puzzle game with 3 personalities

content.label: A lovely side scroll game that requires you use a square, short rectangle and a tall rectangle to help each other to complete the level.
This game is really fun and u should buy it. Intriguing story and good puzzles.

This is a brilliant game with simplistic puzzles that are entertaining to complete when in a state of boredom. It is basic in many of it's aspects, but has a great plot and narrative to keep it interesting.

If yu like play forming games that require patience and skill you'll love this game. If you want a mindless thrill ride go elsewhere. 

Simplistic, soothing and beautifully designed. Updates are welcomed. New levels would be a huge reason for more positive reviews.

I really enjoyed the style and feel of this narrative driven platformer.  It's definitely a gamer's game, with lots of little references to pop culture and video games in general.  Although it's not super challenging, and the level design isn't groundbreaking, many of the areas are cleverly constructed and the pacing of the game feels right.  I did notice in this version on my iPad that achievements only appeared to unlock at the beginning of the game, though when I checked in the Game Center they were becoming unlocked as I progressed.  Also, about two thirds of the way in I began to have serious issues with my mifi controller, where the game would suddenly get stuck pushing me in one direction or jumping repeatedly, even when I switched to just iPad controls.   I had to reset the game completely and unsync my controller to alleviate this, finishing the game with touch controls only.  It doesn't keep this game from being a very cool little platformer that is easy to recommend!  Maybe in the future the devs will come through and patch some of these minor issues.
I played this game on my Mac and am delighted to see it on mobile as well.
Good fun

This game's gameplay is mediocre, but the story is fresh and genuinely thought-provoking. Instead of an archetypical good vs. evil story, the main characters make an unexpected sacrifice, leaving you to wonder whether you'd be willing to do the same.

Not only are the graphics minimally beautiful, but the color scheme and music, combined with the fantastic character development, makes this one of my favorite games of all time. It's just challenging enough to be fun.
I heard about this game on a PlayStation Podcast and decided to give it a go. Such fun gameplay along with a quirky narrative make this the best iPhone game I've ever played. Well worth it.
This is a terrific platformer that will make you think. The story is fascinating and will make you want to keep going.

I have this on PS3 via plus and at the time I thought it was nothing remarkable but as soon as I started playing I fell in love with it. I'm a gamer that's hard to please, but it manages to entertain me. I'm so happy I can take this on the go, it's great for cheering me up while I'm on my ten minute break. 

I even brought it for my brother to play.
Finally a game I can get lost in. Great soundtracks and narration.
Worth it.  Buy it.

title.label: One of the best games of all time

content.label: Great Story. Amazing Voice Over. Fun Challenging Puzzle. Makes you grow to care for the characters disputed them being nothing but shapes. I made a top ten 2013 games list on YouTube and it was #2 which is impressive for a indie game. Best indie game I've played. Highly recommend it. I've bought on three different platforms, PSN, Xbox Live, and IOS just to have it everywhere.

title.label: Great, but the arrows are too close!

content.label: This is such a great game and I can't stop playing it! I love the narrative and all the characters, and it's just challenging enough to keep me interested without being impossibly difficult. My only complaint is that the movement arrows are extremely close together. I keep accidentally going the wrong way...and in a rushed level (water rising, imminent spikes, etc.) this is really frustrating. I'd love to see this addressed! Thanks for the game :)
Mildly challenging levels accompany a dark and compelling story with great characters. Could play forever if it was long enough

This is a fun, heartwarming platformer. The puzzles and timing will be familiar to long-time players of the genre, but the atmosphere and narration are a welcome change that make the gameplay all the more enjoyable.
Only just started and Im already in love with it!
A fantastic narrative too!

title.label: I fell in love with the trailer

content.label:
It felt different. After playing the first world. The tutorial, essentially. I would recommend this game to anyone. 

I look forward to what is yet to come.
The basic graphics hide a nice little platformer puzzler and the story makes you want to keep pushing forward. Well worth the price of admission.
It is an amazing platform we with incredible gameplay. The narrator is absolutely perfect for this game. I think this game is worth $5.00. Bossa, Make more games like this please.
